--- title: Gluteus Minimus Muscle --- # Overview ::: {#tbl-oian-glute-minimus .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Gluteus Minimus Ilium gluteal surface (inferior to gluteus medius origin) Greater trochanter (anterolateral surface) Superior gluteal n. Entire mm.: Abduction, Frontal stabilization
Anterior fibers: Flexion, IR
Posterior fibers: Extension, ER
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} Ilium (gluteal surface below the origin of gluteus medius) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} Greater trochanter of the femur (anterolateral surface) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Innervation {#innervation} The gluteus maximus muscle is innervated by nerve roots [L4]({{< var ref-nerve-root.l4 >}}), [L5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.l5 >}}), and [S1]({{< var ref-nerve-root.s1 >}}), via the [Superior gluteal nerve]({{< var ref-superior-gluteal-nerve.path >}}) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - Entire muscle: abducts the hip, stabilizes the pelvis in the coronal plane @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Anterior fibers: flexion and internal rotation @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Posterior fibers: extension and external rotation @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020
